TopicTitle: [STEAM] Are purchases on the steam store eligable for the "free" expansions.

Articles.Content:
I have searched the forum to the best of my ability and found 2 threads

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/24971-A-bit-of-confusion-that-I-could-find-and-answer-to?highlight=steam

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/25969-A-question-about-the-Expansion-Blog-post?highlight=steam

Both are badly titled for their question and neither received the specific response I am looking for, So i decided to create a thread that is properly labeld.

As to the question in the title

I am referring to this blog post by the KSP team.

More specifically this line here

So given that this was a point of confusion, and that we believe that no matter what, a promise is a promise, we are including Expansions in what you can expect to get for free if you have already bought the game. Also, for those considering purchasing the game, we will maintain this promise for all purchases made until the end of this month (April, 2013).

Please don't fill the thread with "speculation". The main line that can be interpreted is this one

we will maintain this promise for all purchases made until the end of this month (April, 2013).

And it sates all purchases so i guess that means yes to steam.

However nowhere is it specified whether steam purchases are eligible for this, and the reason I ask is that the team may have issues with getting precisely who did and didn't purchase before X date from steam (I am not aware of how open steam is about this to developers), or if they have a system in place for this.

A suggestion to the team if this is an issue is to do what borderlands 2 etc have done, create a "Season pass" dlc and give it to all the people who own the game at steam time 00:00 may 1st.

Personally I would buy the DLC/Expansions separately if I'm not eligible and not be fussed about it. The game is too good for me to slant it for not receiving "free" DLC/Expansions that I may or may not really be entitled to as it came about due to confusion.
As we're talking about a game that is not near half finished, all those talks about DLC and expansions sounds so... frightening

I'm positive Steam keeps track of when you buy games and whatnot. It keeps track of damn near everything else, and at the very least they'd have your credit card transaction on file. Also, given Squad's plans for in-game Spaceport integration, I would imagine they'll set it up so that you can also purchase any DLC or expansions through the same interface. Since at that point they're already connecting to their own servers, if seems logical to me that they will, at the same time, check your eligibility through Steam as well as their own stuff.

Also, keep in mind, Squad is basically just a bunch of gamers. Heck, from what I understand, several of their devs were modders here on the forums before they got hired. So they're not likely to go all EA on us.

Edited April 25, 2013 by loppnessmonsta
